intro: Crepinella disparifolia, commonly known as the variable-leaved crepinella, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value is appreciated in gardens for its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
